title: Exploring the impact of public services on quality of life indicators
abstractText:
Public service organisations are expected to make a major contribution to the quality of life enjoyed by citizens, measured in concepts such as public safety, provision of education and access to healthcare services. Yet it is not necessarily straightforward to trace the direct link between the specific actions of the public services and their impact on quality of life.

In England, the Audit Commission has drawn up a series of ten themes of quality of life indicators, in areas such as housing, community safety, education and health. Of course, the outcomes of public service organisations are closely interlinked â€“ it is not only increased health care provision, but also better housing, sanitation, income, and education which all have an impact on the health of individuals in a community.

The purpose of this study is to gain an understanding of the ways in which public service organisations influence indicators of quality of life at a local level, and to make quantitative estimates of that contribution.

The study will explore these issues by generating a comprehensive dataset based on quality of life indicators, various measures of deprivation and some additional performance indicators of key public sector services.
